title: Computer vision research intern - CEA LVML
tasks: Studying whether neural fields can serve as interpretable implicit 3D scene representations
State of the art of the existing approaches to interpreting Neural Fields
Research and implementation of a (confidential) method aimed at making Neural Fields interpretable and directly improving their interpretability
Implementation of a multi-scene training approach to transition to an interpretation method that can generalize to a range of unseen scenes during training.

title: Computer vision research intern  - CNRS LIS
tasks: Interdisciplinary project between archaeology and computer vision. The objective was to find an approach for segmenting stone blocks in 3D models of archaeological sites.

Training of an instance segmentation model using Detectron2 to detect stone blocks in archaeological site images. Model optimization through data augmentation techniques, with performance metrics visualized in TensorBoard
Transposition of 2D segmentation results into 3D to automate stone-by-stone 3D documentation using photogrammetry and geometry based methods.
Research & development of a methode allowing the meaning of the segmentation mask in 3D
Deployment of the models on the annotation tool CVAT
